channel.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64
channel.description:
Hey guys i've recently found my old copy of blade runner and i tried installing it on my 64 bit win7 and it didn't work because it was a 16 bit app but i found a work around and installed it and it runs, however in the game the characters and objects to interact with are consistently flickering, as is the ingame KIA and menu. I'm not quite ready to give up on it and any help would be appreciated i'm running 64bit Win7 6gb of RAM with a nvidia gt220
EDIT: i've also tried all the compatibility options

item.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64
item.dc:creator: Sky25
item.description:
Ok. And now a little fix for the “Garbled screen problem” (and maybe other issues) without the need to use the “ALT+TAB” keys: Search in Google for the “bitpatch ddwrapper” and download the file “ddwrapper.zip”.
Extract ddwrapper.zip in the Game’s directory and edit the file “aqrit.cfg” with notepad or wordpad.
Leave all the values to the right with an “1” except “Wine_Diablo” and “NovideoMemory”, there you should put a “0”.
This works for Windows 7 (Ultimate) but should work also in other versions of W7 and Vista.

Read full topic

item.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64
item.dc:creator: James.Curse
item.description:
StOnE:

Many people including myself play BC2 flawlessly on Windows 7. There’s got to be something else going on in your machine.

I don’t know what else to do. I will try installing it in the pc of a friend and see what happens.

BTW, I’ve windows 7 ultimate, IDK if there might be some security measure or something that creates lag.

Read full topic

item.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64
item.dc:creator: Scrab_on_mars
item.description:
Never mind…

Read full topic

item.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64
item.dc:creator: StOnE
item.description:
James.Curse:

I didn’t have my hopes up for it but totally exceed my expectations.
The only thing is that Bad Company 2 is unplayable as it gets very laggy (I heard that also happens with Vista).

Many people including myself play BC2 flawlessly on Windows 7. There’s got to be something else going on in your machine.

Read full topic

item.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64
item.dc:creator: ac3d
item.description:
This worked for me with Starcraft which has color issues as well, every few minutes during gameplay the screen will flash, the first flash is usually when the colors mess up, but after I tried this:

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\DirectDraw\Compatibility\StarCraft116]
“Name”=“Starcraft.EXE”
“ID”=hex:ca,89,65,49
“Flags”=hex:00,08,00,00

it works fine now, the flashes still happen but the color stays normal, alt-tab doesn’t set it off either, maybe these can be changed to work with your game? welcome anyone to fix’d

Read full topic

item.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64
item.dc:creator: Nightmare470
item.description:
Janet:

I found my copy of this the other day and can’t get it to install at all on my 64 bit win 7. Would you mind telling me what the work around you found is? I’m desperate to play this again! Thanks

https://www.davidmillington.net/news/index.php/2008/03/26/blade_runner_game_vista_64

Just follow his instructions, it’s fairly simple and pretty straightforward.

SURPLUS_NiNjA:

I just did a google and have you tried alt-tabing out and back in again. Apparently that helped some people.

Yes, when you start up the intro is messed up, alt-tab works to fix that but the characters and objects are still flickering

Read full topic

item.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64

item.description:
I just did a google and have you tried alt-tabing out and back in again. Apparently that helped some people.

item.title: Blade Runner Game on Win7 64
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
You can run it from the task manager. Or make a Bat file, like this one (For starcraft)

taskkill /f /IM explorer.exe
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Starcraft\StarCraft.exe”
start explorer.exe

Read full topic

item.description:

item.description:
you can pick up win 98 for £10-£20 on ebay and get virtualbox free from SUN. You’ll be able to run a load of old games on that. Or maybe linux with WINE could run it, it is pretty old.
